topic.title: HPE Helion Public Cloud Object Storage Overview

body.p: Leveraging OpenStack Storage, HPE Helion Public Cloud object storage provides a way to store and retrieve objects in a highly redundant cluster of publicly accessible physical machines hosted in HPE data centers. Key terms include:

ul.li: Object - The basic storage entity, most typically a file
Container - A compartment for storing Objects

body.p: The best way to learn more is to start using it yourself over at the HPE Helion Public Cloud Console. If you have any questions, try our Forums where you can learn from our own internal experts as well as other users in the HPE Helion Public Cloud community.

section.title: API
section.p: Do you need low level, raw REST API access to HPE Helion Public Cloud object storage? Trot on over to the Object Storage API page for details.

section.title: Bindings
section.p: Got a favorite programming language? Don't like to deal with the guts of a REST API? Take a look at our Bindings section to see what your options are for writing code against HPE Helion Public Cloud Object Storage.

section.title: CLI
section.p: If you need a scriptable interface, look at our CLI documentation.
